page.title: 06CHURCH HISTORY.
page.content: {ST.MICHAEL'S CHURCH.} This church fell into decay in 1848.It was thought impossible to restore,so it became a ruin.The old chancel of the church did have a roof and the only services then held there were funerals. It was in such a poor state that it was better to build a new church than restore St.Michaels.In the Domesday Book a priest is mentioned, so it must have been once an old { {SAXON CHURCH} made of mud and wattle walls and a thatched roof.{NORMAN} work can be seen today.The present Norman arch<on the south side> once formed the church porch.Following the Norman influence,a number further alterations were made to the church up to the time it fell into ruins.Parishioners about 25 years ago
